answers.answer: Its not bad and they issue it a pretty good bit in pregnancy. Mainly to monitor and make sure everything looks good with baby. They hook you up to a monitor that measures baby's heart beat sees if you're having contractions and you press a button every time baby kicks.
OK thank you! I'm looking forward to seeing how the baby is doing!
Mine was different I never had to do anything if the baby kicked, the machine picked it up. Thru just hook two monitors on you and watch them

The one at the hospital picked it up based on heartbeat but the one at my doctors office had me press a button every time I felt baby move. It depends on how long doctor wants you on it. At the hospital they kept me on it for a little over an hour bc I was having contractions and at the doctors office 20 minutes bc everything was looking good

question: Does everyone get one or is it only when they're concerned about the baby? My bp has been creeping up, and I've had a lot of swelling. It's not preeclampsia yet because there isn't any protein in my urine, but they want to watch for it. My doctor is having me do the non stress test Sunday. What should I expect?
title: non stress test
